story.title: Letters on the Wind
story.author: ChronoCanvas Studio
story.description: Bottled notes wash ashore at dawn, each penned in the same graceful hand. When you finally meet the writer, a storm bears down and a developer eyes your boathouse. Love, like tide, asks: will you anchor--or sail?

nodes.title: Boathouse Quiet
nodes.narration: The boathouse smells of cedar and rope; hulls rest like sleeping whales. You unfold the letter on your workbench, and the words settle into your ribs. Outside, the tide climbs a rung on the ladder.

nodes.title: Bookshop Corner
nodes.narration: A bell tinkles as you duck into the harbor bookshop; the owner knows every love story by salt-smell. You find a sea journal with blank charts, a perfect place to chart a life together. The first page waits for a compass rose.

choices.text: Buy the journal as a gift.
Leave a pressed wildflower inside for Amaya to find.

nodes.title: Workshop Dream
nodes.narration: You walk her through the boathouse plans: benches, loaner tools, Friday potluck varnish nights. She sketches signage as if it already hangs, brush letters dancing. Hope smells like cedar and warm bread.

choices.text: Push to secure permits before the storm.
Race the regatta together to win donations.

nodes.title: Storm, Then Sun
nodes.narration: You brace windows, sandbag doors, and share soup with neighbors by candlelight. Morning sifts gold through the clouds; the boathouse stands--scarred, sturdy, claimed. You and Amaya dance paint across the repaired beams, laughter louder than gulls.
